tagline: A project that introduce backbone.js by creating a simple yet powerful comment system. It uses Bootstrap for the UI, backbone.js and jQuery.
body:
#Backbone Comments

###What

Backbone Comments is a small project that shows the power and the simplicity of a backbone application by creating a comments system. 

###How

1. Install [git](http://git-scm.com/)
2. Install [node.js](http://nodejs.org/)
3. Install [mongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/)

Now you have everything you need to start using and modifying bakconejs-comments:
```
// Clone the repo
$ git clone https://github.com/ricca509/backbonejs-comments.git
$ cd backbonejs-comments
// Install dependencies
$ npm install
// Launch the server
$ node server.js
```

* [Backbone.js](http://backbonejs.org/)
* [jQuery](http://jquery.com/)
* [Bootstrap](http://twitter.github.com/bootstrap/)

**Server-side**

* [node.js](http://nodejs.org/)
* [express](http://expressjs.com/)
* [mongoose](http://mongoosejs.com/)
* [mongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/)

If you have any questions or feedback, feel free to contact me using [@CoppolaRiccardo](https://twitter.com/CoppolaRiccardo) on Twitter.
